alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Grayson; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 3:58AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following areas, in North Carolina, Alleghany NC, Ashe, Stokes, Surry, Watauga, Wilkes and Yadkin. In southwest Virginia, Carroll, Floyd, Grayson and Patrick. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A slow moving low pressure over the Tennessee Valley will keep showers around into Thursday. There looks to a be lull in the heavier rain today, before it increases again Thursday. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rain will be possible through Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
